WRITING.TITLE: Ways to Save Money Each Month?
WRITING.TEXT: Wanted to ask everyones opinion on ways to save extra cash each month. My wife and I are officially debt free (minus mortgage) and I want to knock that one out next. The ones I heard recently were: 1. washing clothes/dishes after 8pm I believe due to electricity being cheaper. 2. Order groceries online and pickup at store to not impulse buy. Aka promote meal planning. 3. Set thermostat lower in winter and higher in summer 4. Drop cable and use netflix or be a pirate ;) Others I found were watching a Youtube video by this person: https://youtu.be/lhhMKPoJ7p0 She had some good tips but I bet we can all come up with the not run of the mill ideas that will help.
And thats the end of unlocked dumpsters as we know it. We maybe have a year or two left before its gone... Neighborhood trash cans should survive though lol
Found this girls channel while looking for ebay videos, she recently made a long vid about how she finds her inventory for her store. https://youtu.be/zRLir3mtRCU
Mostly car related projects. Currently swapped my civic hatchback and am documenting the process!

Thanks and subbed back! Grew up in Orlando till I moved up North. In Ohio currently. Lets figure something out collab wise. I need to check out your vids and your website is incredible! Shoot me an email and we'll talk: thestauffergarage@gmail.com
Swapped it into my Ek hatch! If you want to see my build log, I have it all posted on my channel: www.youtube.com/stauffergarage
Swapped it into my Ek hatch! Check out my Youtube channel for the build if you are interested: https://goo.gl/1VXxuT
You are correct. Seats already in the civic Rear brake conversion Integra front subframe, all arms, steering rack F R sway bars Calipers, hubs, etc f r. Master cylinder as well.
Agree, I still need to tidy up some of the civic this motor went into. With the Skunk 2 manifold I was able to delete the evap stuff along with the IAB system. Helped some
